intro: Piriqueta villosa, commonly known as the hairy piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and compound leaves with a feathery appearance. Its small white to greenish flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Piriqueta villosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
